title: Clinical On-Site Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a multi phase interview, Character based questions that covered the "core" Principals that are listed on their website. Asked for examples of prior work experience that would involve each principal. Let your resume do the talking about experience and education, promote yourself in regards to work history and decision making via your answers in the interview. First "interview" was a phone interview with HR, 2nd was an in-person interview with HR and Sr. Admin, 3rd interview was a peer interview. Was a lengthy process, and multiple weeks between interviews. Overall, was very professional and not stressful aside from the wait times between interviews and being notified you had advanced to the next step.
Interview Questions: Give an example where you have shown integrity in your prior work experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews - one with HR, one with hiring manager. Both were held virtually - no more interviews were needed. HR was easier than the other - pretty formal. Asked to describe certain areas of your job for specific things.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education
Interview Descriptions: It was one of the hardest interviews I had to face, but the questions and interview was over an hour, it was very formal and not laid back but everyone was nice just intimidating.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you showed integrity at your place of work

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview process. Phone interview, leadership interview, peer interview for 2 department employees. Ask follow up questions. Dress appropriately. Don’t be late.  Know the CORE values of the organization.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you used integrity.

title: Director, Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: terrible interview team, the questions were interesting but not telling of the candidates skills and abilities. The interview couldn't pick the winner of a one horse race. Former HR person was not a fit, I now know why?
Interview Questions: had to submit answers to questions and then were asked similar question on a zoom meeting

title: Intake Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed numerous times. The process lasted for nearly three months. While I applied for a specific position, I was offered and interviewed for an entry level position. I felt invested in the company after the interview process.
Interview Questions: Most of the interview questions were based on conflict resolution.

title: Procurement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioral based questions.  Nothing tricky.  The questions seem to be based off of their values listed on their website.  The process was unnecessarily lengthy.  From the time of initial contact, to an in person interview was about a month.
Interview Questions: If a family was very upset with the donation process, how would you handle it?

title: Recovery Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in-person interview, job shadow and peer interview. It was long and drawn out for whatever reason. At the time, I was happy to get an interview, in the end, I wish I'd passed.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of general questions. Why you want to work at CORE

title: CIO Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education
Interview Descriptions: Thorough phone, then multiple in person meetings. All of the meetings were probably not necessary to determine fit. Seemed like dedicated employees, but poor work life balance throughout and same expectation if hired.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education
Interview Descriptions: Long periods of time elapse between interviews.  If they decide not to move forward with you, you'll receive a letter in the mail so don't expect a personal phone call after you've committed your time and effort over several months.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with an aggressive employee.

title: Community Outreach Coordinator for WV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screening by the HR Assoc. Director.  - told it there would be 2 more interviews
1:1 interview with Director of Community Outreach & two others (1 conferenced by phone)
Trip to Pittsburgh (at my cost) to interview with two Community Outreach Coordinators
Surprise 4th step interview with CEO
Interview Questions: How do you balance work & life

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Center for Organ Recovery & Education (Pittsburgh, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Fragmented HR Interview Process. Face to Face Interview was not scheduled for almost 2 months after phone interview.
Interview Questions: Uses Behavioral-Based interviewing, but scenarios were vague and only minimally applicable to the job being discussed.
